review_body: Thé hôtel located in good place ... You can visit many famous place .. The station about 2 min for the hotel ..Staff were very helpful and kind .. Thé room simple and confortable .. Thank you , for sûre i will come back again ^^

My family and I wanted to spend New Year’s in Tokyo, so we booked a week at Sakura Hotel Jimbocho. This is personally my 3rd/4th time staying here, so it’s safe to say I really like it here.Best part for me is the staff, led by Peter Chen. Yeah, the rooms are a little small, but it is the best value place I have stayed in Tokyo. Besides, what are you doing in Tokyo if you’re just going to stay in your room?Actually, I did stay in my room for a good chunk of our last trip since I got sick. And I was so thankful that the beds were plenty comfortable for me, and I was able to get back on my feet after only a couple of days.The all-you-can-drink tea (among other drinks) at the 1F had a lot to do with it.So thanks again to the crew at Sakura Jimbocho for taking care of me.

The employees are super nice and helpful, the rooms are cleaned daily and the location is perfect for exploring Tokyo by metro or on foot. We stayed two weeks and don't regret a single night! A small Tipp: If you travel with your significant other, take bunk beds. Most double beds are a bit on the short side for two people!

Staff were welcoming, friendly, and had great recommendations for places to eat. The facilities (for showering, etc) were clean and the hotel was quiet and well-situated to explore Tokyo. Next time I’m in Tokyo, I’ll stay there again

I've stayed at some other Sakura Hotel locations before, and this, like the others is in a great location. Close to the station and many other tourist attractions and restaurants around kept the stay interesting and fun.

The staff are very friendly and helpful, and all of them are speaking enough English for a real conversation. Which is very unusual in Japan, even at hotels of a much higher price class, I can tell you from experience.The rooms are small but tidy. For the price you simply can`t expect more at Tokyo. Especially at a hotel with this splendid location! From the underground station Jimbocho you reach everything in Tokyo in short time, and the Imperial palace, Yasukuni-Shrine, are in walking distance. And book lane is just arround the corner.This was my third stay there and I`m sure to come back in future.

Sakura hotel's staff were polite and helpful with all information you might need. The free breakfast was great and you could eat early. The price was very affordable and made up for the rooms being on the smaller side. Stayed here twice while we explored Japan. Will be booking again when we visit in the future. Loved it. We even got a free upgrade on our second stay!

great location close to Jimbocho-station and Imperial Palace gardenvery friendly, helpful staffearly starting breakfastwould always return here when visting Tokyo again, if the good price is kept as it was

We stayed there on Feb, 2020 end for 3 days. The Guys at desk (Taz and others) are very much helpful and smiley. The breakfast is also ok with the price we paid (Soup was tasty and healthy). The location is very convenient (24X7 shops are nearby, Jimbocho station is 3-4 min walking etc) and very calm. Only negative thing is the room is small and compact, but thats not an issue for us. For the price and location, a room in Tokyo should not be bigger than this. Common toilet and bath rooms are very clean. Next i visit to Japan, i want to stay again in this hotel. Thanking you.

I gained great experiences in my stay at this hotel. Staff gave good instructions on where to move around in Japan. Room was as clean as ever. Hygiene was perfect as expected. All in all, it was a very good hotel to stay in.

I stayed here 4 years ago and I have to say that the place still has the same feeling as it did way back in 2016. Staffs are super friendly and always greeting guests when they return back or heading out. I had a nice chat with a lady (sorry I did not get her name) when I was checking out about the property and Kaz (another staff) and how he was the one that checked me and my family out back in 2016. I didn't manage to talk to him as he was always working the night shift. Overall a pleasant place to stay, super cozy and several Family Mart's around which makes it easy to buy food / drinks. Would definitely stay at this place the next time I return to Japan!

It was a lovely hotel for the basics. Great price, amazing staff and a really nice touch of complimentary coffee and toast, which definitely helped our budget. You could also get a selection of teas and soup. Great for backpackers.

This was a terrific stay. Very nice, clean rooms and well kept bathrooms despite being shared. The cafe downstairs has some wonderful food options and they were able to accommodate my allergies with gluten free food options at breakfast. Plus, all the staff were very helpful and easy to communicate with.

This is a super nice hotel. Although this was my first experience for one bed from 8 beds room, I found it was very clean hotel. Staff there are the best part of this hotel - they are friendly, warm-heart and helpful.

Stayed for five nights on an impromptu trip in Feb 2020. I hadn’t made any plans before i arrived, but had a couple of ideas. The staff were super helpful and in particular Kanae and Shin spent a long time helping me find a good day trip to go skiing. Big thanks to both of them!Rooms were clean and comfortable and bathroom facilities good. Close proximity to Jimbocho subway station makes travel around the city easy and plenty of nice restaurants within 5 minutes walk, as well as some good food and a good selection of beer in the cafe downstairs. Thanks everyone for a lovely stay.

Close to Akihabara and Tokyo Dome, this quality Hotel was perfect for my stay in Tokyo.I was able to meet a ton of people to travel with and explore Tokyo. The check in process was easy and the staff were very friendly.

Staffs at hotel are very helpful. I greatly appreciate the staff who helps me during my check-in in the middle of the night. The fact that he gives me valuable pointers, tips and helpful directions help me a lot as a first time tourist to Tokyo. Variety of tea and hot soup available for breakfast is amazing! I'll definitely stay here again when I visit Tokyo next time. With great hospitality, value for money and strategic location, there's no reason for me not to stay again in this place when I return next time. Staffs need to fix the hot shower though. I couldn't turn the water any cooler. It was scalding the skin on my head when I took my shower in the winter.

It was nice place to sleep and rest. The I slept was a tiny room, but it had bed and heater, tv. It can be unconfortable for some people who don't like to eat meals in public space, but for me it was nice.Cafe was clean, staffs were really nice and kind.Next time I go to Japan, I would like to go sakura hotel again.

This is a very nice hostel with a good location- you can easy to go to everywhere in Tokyo by metro. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Everyday I have to bother them a lot - ask how I can get here and there, and also I get the medical help for my stomach ache. All staff who work in reception counter and the cafe can speak very good English. I highly recommend this hotel. 这家青年旅馆地理位置很好，从酒店出发通过地铁和火车，你哪儿哪儿都能去。酒店的员工非常友善，并且乐于助人，在居住期间，我几乎每天都要跟他们询问乘车路线以及给我药物治疗我的胃痛，前台和咖啡厅的员工都能说很好的英语。我非常推荐这家酒店。

This is my first time in Japan. And I was not disappointed to stay here. Aside from the very clean toilets and comfortable room, I was amazed and so grateful to their staff specially with Shinichi Tada for helping us communicate and trace my lost money - ALL MY YEN was there on the envelope!! Imagine how I felt the moment I realize I lost it all! :( I was not expecting that this will be returned to me since I was not also sure if I left it in the street going back to the hotel. I was so delighted knowing that the staff on the store where I last checked my money kept my envelope!!! Japanese people are really honest!! I was able to get my money back because of Shinichisan! Sorry I was not able to ask for a selfie. But I will definitely be back in Tokyo and will be staying here again. Arigatou Gozaimasu!

Excellent Location.Best Place for International Visitors.24/7 cafe with delicious & Halal food.Staff are very cooperative, KAZUTO San is very nice guy He is very friendly and lovely.I highly recommend this Hotel for stay in Tokyo.

very good and smily people, helpfull ! very good and smily people, helpfull !very good and smily people, helpfull !very good ans smily people, helpfull !very good and smily people, helpfull !I am tired...

After booking and cancelling three other accommodations in Tokyo, I settled on the Sakura Hotel in Jimbocho. A good move, as it turned out: friendly staff, simple yet delicious breakfast, comfortable single rooms, clean toilets and showers, central location . . . If I can lock in a similar rate on my next trip to Tokyo, I will certainly be staying here again.

Stayed here many times every year I go on vacation. Great single rooms for a solo traveler. The dorms are great aswell. Great free breakfast every morning. All the staff is very fluent in English and many speak other languages aswell. I also like the events they encourage you to go. They are great experiences.

The hostel is in a great location in walking distance from the imperial palace. If you’re looking for a spanish/english/mandarin speaking person, Peter, the hostel manager is definitely the person you’re looking for. Very clean rooms and bathrooms!

We had a wonderful stay in Sakura! Kids loved the bunker beds, there was free breakfast, rooms were cleaned everyday, and we were surprised to learn that there was unlimited soda, juice, tea and drinks. The hotel is near the Jimbocho station and staff were very friendly. Worth the stay!!

good service, receptionis helpfull , room is clean, more restaurant near hotel, near family mart and sevel, near jimbocho station, and delucious breakfast ,sakura jimbocho hotel is good for family too

Great hotel, nice atmosphere. Went out of their way to try to help with gluten free issue for a coeliac. Close to metro station and central. Only issue we had was getting a room with all bunks initially when we had requested a bed and bunks but they moved us the following day. Some very friendly staff and everyone was very helpful.

The location of the hostel is fantastic. The services including the cheap cafe and breakfast is also pretty good.However the private room is so small we could barely stand and fit our bags in there as well. It was quite noisy with noise restrictions from only midnight-5am.If you're only staying for a quick layover - it's perfect.

Pros: 1. great location for metro/Toei 2. Shared bathrooms/showers are really clean3. Shower room is spacious Cons:1. Charging plug is limited in room2. Room smells a little weird 3. Shower towel rental for ¥100Overall great experience

Comfortable room and clean bathrooms.The staffs are all kind and friendly.Price reasonable and worthy.Recommend to single travelers and several friends to share one room together.Nice experience in Tokyo.

A great stay for solo travelers, couples, friends groups, and families. The Sakura Hotel, Jimbocho is a cozy five story guesthouse with a 24-hour café on the first floor (free WiFi and community PC). There are several room options: dormitory-style bunkbeds in group rooms as well as private couples rooms with semi-double sized beds.In the past year, I've stayed here twice with my partner. Both times, we were able to reserve private rooms.  The atmosphere is super relaxed and definitely caters to young, international, and ambitious travelers. The doors are open 24 hours and you can come and go as you please. Expect to hear a plethora of languages spoken from both guests and staff alike. Much of the staff is trilingual and you should have no difficulty communicating. The café has a brilliantly eclectic menu with a creative spread of worldly food and drink options. There are also many complementary amenities such at hot water for tea, coffee, and free toasted bread for breakfast.Weather you just need to grab a quick bite to eat, or you're looking for a cozy place to spend the night, I highly recommend the Sakura Café

I only stayed here one night and it was enjoyable enough. I arrived and was created pleasantly. Lucky to have the whole room to myself I could sprawl out, if the room was full there wouldn't be much space unfortunately. Room and showers were basic, which I was after and breakfast was really nice. Toast and soup, soup was really yummy especially on a rainy winters day. Check out painless and train station super close, walking distance!

Room, shower, bed, toilet are clean. The breakfast was great. The slipper and yukata are great to wear inside the room and the hotel. And not forget to mention the umbrella, we can borrow the umbrella to embrace tokyo’s rain. Definitely will stay in sakura jimbocho if we go to tokyo anytime in the future. The only down sides are no common kitchen and if you are coming from tokyo station and bring a large suitcase, you’ll need to change train twice. Other than that, shinjuku, shibuya is only one line away. And the metro station is so near

Cozy with good location and super friendly welcoming staff. only 2 stops to the Tokyo station and 3 mins walk to the Jimbocho subway station. In walking distance to Palace and even Ginza. from Haneda international airport you need to take the Keikyu line and transfer to subways. 24 hours open good atmosphere cafe inside the hotel. You can get free soft drinks all day. Amazing place to meet up other travelers. I will definitely stay here again when I come to Tokyo. Highly recommend.

I stayed at the Asakusa hotel, and I needed to go a little north for an activity, so the staff introduce me to their sister branch in Jimbocho. And might I say, Twas' a magnificent feel to it just like the other one. There is. a share room in the lobby area so it was nice to communicate with other travelers.

My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel in the beginning of December. Here are the thing that we liked:*The big plus is CLEANLINESS! I have heard that Japanese people take care a lot about hygiene, but I didn't except such a high level of cleanliness everywhere. Toilets and showers were all the time very, very clean and we had a room with a shared bathroom (shower and toilets were separated). There was a daily cleaning room service too.* We got kimono alike towels that we really like! :)* The neighborhood is quiet, so there will be no noise to wake you up.* Markets and restaurants are within walking distance, as well as Imperial Palace with its beautiful gardens.* The metro station is very near. Additional info: you can buy daily tickets for metro at the front desk, that are cheaper than to buy it at the metro station.* Staff was very kind and friendly.And the things that we liked less:* Size of the room - rooms are super small (we stayed at double room with shared bathroom), but if you stay out all day like us, then this will not be a problem for you* Breakfast - same things every day: soup, toast and different jams

Went to Tokyo for 3 days and decided to check into this gem of a hostel; friendly staff, clean accommodations and it's bustling with cultures! The team makes an effort in getting the guests to mingle and hang out. Shout out to the manager Peter for making my stay nothing short of awesome. He went out of his way to answer any doubts and queries I had and even threw in some great sightseeing recommendations. Don't miss out if you're looking for a stay in Tokyo! Really convenient to get round from there.

Easy to find the hotel & just few minute from subway station. Walking distance to Imperial Palace. Very clean room as staff helped to clean the room everyday. Only 2 bathroom to share but still manageable. Variety drinks is free to drink.

decent space and privacy for a dorm room stay, reasonable shared bathroom facilities, nice main floor cafe area. laundry machines could use some work, dryer was somewhat ineffective, be ready to pull out a damp load.

great location, 5 mins walking from Jimbocho Station (Toei Line). the staffs are friendly and really helpful if we ask something about Tokyo. the room is clean, shared shower room and toilet also clean. their bar is 24 hour so no worry if you hungry in the middle of the night.

I went with my wife, and stayed on a private room. At the beginning was skeptical about the shared bathrooms and showers, but all was in order and clean, and never had any problem. The food in the café was very nice and with several options. The staff always friendly. And the location, just a 5 minutes walk from the nearest subway station.

The location is not far from local subways station, just 5 minutes walk. The staffs can communicate in English. They are helpful and warmly. The foods and drinks are reasonable price. If you are the guest, you could get free soft drinks all day.

Amazingly clean, very friendly and our room was very big! Subway station just a few minutes away and free drinks machine for all day use. We enjoyed our stay in the twin room. I was there with my 4 year old daughter and everyone was super friendly towards us.

excellent 24-hour reception service, accessible to train stations, clean rooms, friendly staff, quiet neighbourhood. This is the best value for your money if you're on a budget trip. ideal for solo female backpackers.

We visited hotel Sakura Jimbocho with a group of 10 school children. The facilities were very well suited to our group. A lovely cafe, clean and tidy rooms and incredibly helpful staff. Thanks for making our trip such a success!

People was very kind and always making their best to make your visit unforgettable, food was good, as well as the location and of course the price. It doesn't matter your kind of travel, this place is for sure very special. Hope you have a good one in Tokyo!

Nice and great place to stay. Really recommend for solo or group of friend traveler. thank you. The breakfast is easy and delicious. Really helpful staff. Comfortable bed and clean. Accessible place to get.

Stayed small double room with shared bathroom. Location is good as it is near to metro station. Check in and check out very fast. The washroom and toilet are clean and satisfied. Staffs are freindly and ready to help. Room rate including simple breakfast.Stayed on Nov 2019.

Has everything you'd expect from a hostel. Clean, quiet, and you get breakfast included. What more could you ask for? Fairly central (being only 2 stops from Tokyo) with lots of good restaurants around.

Sakura Hotel is ideal for tourists who want to discover Tokyo ans the staff is very lovely. Like all youth hostel : a good night depends of your neighborhood, but it's clean and quiet, I recommend this place.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. The accommodation was good value and it was in a convenient location near to subway. You can get food 24 hours and it was ok and reasonably priced and the book market is interesting

During our recent trip to Japan we stayed here twice (at the beginning and then again at the end of our holiday). The staff greeted as like friends on our return. They create such a great atmosphere. The hotel is such a friendly place to stay.The staff make it work that way and so do the other visitors travelling through. The staff are thoughtful and put on visits to areas and tourist attractions at least once a week if you wish to participate in them. There is an all night cafe for food and drinks which we used when we came back in very late from sight seeing and wanted to eat something very close to home. The rooms were small but that didn't bother us. There was a simple breakfast of toast and jams etc but you could purchase extra from the cafe. It is a really jolly place to stay,very central and very near the station.
-Staff membersThey were extraordinary, really informative and knew many languages so there was no confusion. They made me feel like close friends. -Rooms were small but comfortable-Location was great

El alojamiento es excelente y la buena disposición y amabilidad del Sr. Peter Chen son increíbles, Es muy atento con sus huéspedes y el servicio es magnífico, siempre trata de resolver dudas y sugerir panoramas para divertirse en Tokyo. El personal también es muy amable y atento. Completamente recomendado!The lodging is excelent and Mr. Peter Chen helpfulness and kindness are amazing!. He's very kind with their guests and the service is awesome, he always tries to shed light on any doubts the guests have, and he always suggests interesting things to do/places to visit, and so on. The hotel staff is also very kind and attentive to guests' needs and desires. Completely recommended!

The hotel host a lot of fun tours and events regularly where you can make new friends, I went for the imperial palace tour with breakfast and lunch included just for 1000 yen! (Around 8-9 dollars), the imperial palace is beautiful by the way, the staffs are multilingual (mandarin, English, Spanish and some others I think lol) they are very friendly if you have any problems or questions during the trip, they will provide you with great help!! and the cafe is just awesome! All you can drink at the drink bar for only 300 yen!!! (Non-alcohol of course)The most important part is the location! You can get to anywhere in Tokyo in a 30 minute range distance! For example the Tokyo tower and the skytree tower, both can reach within 30 minutes!So, I am definitely coming back here!

Very good hospitality, Excellent Cleaness room, Good Location to use Subway. But for JR Pass user are too far for nearest JR station but for me its ok. 24hrs shower is saver for me if always return nearly midnight. Im staying at private single room and it is very comfortable and relaxing. Next time if I came to tokyo I would like to stay here again if available.

I think the reason why a lot of tourists choose Sakura Hotel is because the staff can speak English. It's easy to ask them for recommendations, which I think is a struggle for most first-timers in Japan.

Perfect experience. Restaurant-bar 24h, central, cozy, clean, fun and multicultural. A very good option to stay in Tokyo.If we ever return, we will surely repeat. The location is very central and you can walk to the imperial palace.

It is a very, very good Hostel in the Center of Tokyo with a very helpful and friendly stuff. The price is really affordable compared to other accomodatin in this city. Many thanks for all. I am happy, to have found it. Karl from Germany

For a hostel, it's OK. It was one of the cheapest hostels in hostel world with good reviews. It seems to attract lots of foreign visitors. They have planned visits to places in Tokyo and around, which is cool. However the single bad part for me is that the wifi simply does not work inside the shared bedroom. Also, the bedroom is in a basement without windows. But for the price, and considering it's Tokyo, it is OK.

My experience at the hotel was very pleasant and painless. The processes were expedient and simple and all the necessary information was provided.The great cafe downstairs and the constant availability of the staff made staying at the hotel extremely convenient. Not to mention the great location as well.

Convenient location, close to both Toei and Metro lines. In walking distance from Palace and even Akiba. However the room itself was rather average, small, stinky and with no place to store bags. Overall this place is solid hostel, don't expect anything extra for the price.

I am travelling to Japan for over 7 years now, and I always come back to this hotel. Staff is friendly and helpful, can grew to be your friends. Rooms are clean and cozy and when staying in dorm you are able to meet many interesting people! Food is good too and the breakfast is inclusive when staying overnight! Location is placed in the heart of Tokyo, with nature (Imperial Palace), City life (Korakuen/Akihabara) and a nice accessibility to tram (Jimbocho Station) is all within walking distance. Sometimes the hotel is even hosting events that are fun to be part of.

I really like the service of this place and food was awesome! Really enjoy your Taco Rice¬But I have a bit discomfort that in my room I don't have any window. I mean I had one but it was close to other building (about 30cm), so it was always dark

We're lucky that three of us stayed in room intended for 5 people (2 bunk beds and 1 sofa bed, which is soft), so we have enough space but 5 ppl may not be able to open their luggage at the same time! Hard pillows, unable to sleep. Quite. You can write off free wifi in the room; in cafeteria (1st floor) it works fine though. Beddings are so so, furniture are old but functioning. The grey carpet shows its age, i can't pinpoint any dirt but didn't want to sit on it or walk barefoot, just in case :-), luckily plastic/fake-leather slippers are provided (good !). Shared toilets (separate for lady & gent), shared bathroom (both sexes). Bathroom lacks of privacy : ppl can see through the glass doors, pls do something. The free towels are small and super thin. They have free flow of tea/coffee, softdrink in cafetaria. For muslim : there are 3 or so 'halal' menu at the same time they serve ramen and salami. There are several combini stores eg. 7-11 etc nearby. There is laundry facility with fee though i don't use it. Staff are friendly enough. Overall, it was ok experience, i may consider it if i visit tokyo again provided it remains price-competitive.

Staff were very helpful and accommodating at all times. You can tell they really care for their guests. Beds were comfortable. Location is also very convenient, if you like walking Imperial Palace East Gardens and Tokyo Station are just 10 mins away!

Good place with friendly stuff, good value rooms and breakfast. Convenient location (3 min from Jimbocho station) is a big plus. Clean toilets and showers. Free soft drinks and tea during the day was such a helpful bonus. Highly recommended to everyone as a good value for money.

Most of Staff are very friendly and helpful and speak clear English , they explain , I really enjoyed the location is good it’s near jimbocho metro station exit A1 Which you go anywhere in Tokyo , breakfast is simple but good enough

Clean, bigger rooms then the most business hotels at the expense of a shared bathroom, which is clean. Room size is at its biggest compared to the other rooms where you barely have a place for your carriers.

Thoughtful and considerate your stay here will leave you wanting for nothing. Perfectly located in close proximity to subways and the beautiful park with the imperial palace. Food and drink available 24/7 and company if you wish. Room was very clean (and very small).

The manager hotel always help us and it really comfort place hotel! Hope i will be back in next year.Clean, comfort, have a little cozy cafeHelp me to print out paper, and many tourist from any country there!

It was our first stay in Japan, alone with two kids, and we felt a very warm welcome. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Very clean, good location, subway and lots of restaurants in walking distance. Highly recommendable.

The good:- Great staff- 24 hours cafe (food tastes great! The breakfast is very basic, but the main dishes are good)- possibility to leave personal belongings at reception- beds are comfy- very good locationthe bad:- moldy ceiling in basement room (dormitory), very bad air quality. Try to book a bed in a 4 person room, those rooms are much better

Great place for backpackers, solo travellers and famiilies.Great restaurant / cafe .Liked how we could sit inside or outside comfortably.Staff happy to help.Bathrooms in good condition.Easy to locate.

Definitely recommend to people but breakfast should be displayed or communicated correctly. Great staff especially NAZ what a great guy! Will definitely make use of them again, and maybe keep smoking area open during evenings just for smoking not nice standing outside to smoke

Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: The hostel’s location is walking distant to Jimbocho metro station. The staffs are very welcoming. I’ve stayed here for the both the dorm and the single room. The dorm bed frame can be slightly shaky as it is not one of those hard wooden structure. The economy offers a slightly more comfortable sleeping experience. 非常推薦這家旅宿，交通方便，旅宿的大家也都很友善。推薦住單人房。上下舖的床架有點晃，同一個上下舖的人翻身的時候會感覺到。

Came to watch rugby game and the staffs were awesome ! Nice service nice lication definitely 5 stars! I will definitely come back again ! Thanks to the team for the excellent work! ArigatouThere is a good cafe on first floor !

My friends got lost on the way here but the journey was worth it. Cute location with style, it also has a cafe with many options. The food was great and very cheap. Definitely a spot for a quick bite or a sit down. Free WiFi too

This hotel is really good for budget traveling! But with High class service. My girlfriend and i are backpacking for 4 months, and they helped Us so much getting around to see Tokyo and Mt. Fuji!The only bad thing i Can say, is the breakfest is only Bread, juice and soup, and then you Can buy eggs, High service with the food, and all in the restaurant is clean! But i really loved this hotel, and are coming back for sure!

Couldn’t have found a better place. Admittedly I was lookin for the cheapest place but I’m sure I enjoyed this place more than a normal hotel. I didn’t socialize with ANY other guests, I did however talk to the hotel staff who were WONDERFUL!!! Absolutely amazing people working there or (seriously) go above and beyond what’s expected of them! Couldn’t recommend this place and more!!

A great place to stay in the middle of Tokyo. Clean, Easy access to everywhere, friendly and very helpful staff, and great value! The café has good food and an impressive collection of craft beer.They also hold a number of cultural exchange events, where you can meet local Japanese people, learn some of the language to help you on your Japan travels, and a nice way to make friends when you are a solo traveller.The hotel is also a meeting point for interesting tours around Tokyo. You can join regular jogging tours around the Palace on Thursday nights, or the seasonal trips to Japanese festivals, events, and of the beaten track adventures.

My girlfriend and I decided to stay together in this hotel knowing it was also a hostel. When it said shared bathroom i was quite worried however it surprised me as bathroom was extremely clean and the soup/shampoo were very good of quality.Eventhough the room were small, it was actually very good enough. Comfortable and very clean. The television channel had less options and all are in Japanese though.

Sakura Hotel provides everything you’d expect but seriously goes above and beyond. The staff are so friendly and helpful, if you have any problem related to your stay OR anything else they WILL help you!I personally had issues with my bank and they let me borrow ¥10,000 (yes, 10,000!!!) for the day until I resolved it and paid them back!!!If I’m staying in Tokyo again, it will be here. 10/10

With passionate staff and environment, I totally enjoyed the best time of my trip during this time. Highly recommend, the dorm have everything you need. I will highly recommend you keep eyes on the board next to the reception, don’t miss out any good vibes and activities with the local.Little union nation i would say!

I love the cozy and friendly vibe in this hotel. The staff are really nice. They speak English and willing to help you with anything. I lost my wallet on the subway and when I told them, I was helped enthusiastically. Besides, the hotel is located near the center of the city which helps you to go to sightseeing places easily. If I come back to Tokyo someday, I will definitely choose this hotel to stay.

Really enjoy the stay here, staffs are nice, room and bathroom are clean, they have elevator and free to hold luggage for you after checkout. The breakfast is simple miso soup and toasts, with lots of drinks including coffee and juice.

Struggled to decide where to stay in Tokyo but we were about 2mn walk from a tube station and 5mn from the Emperor's gardens and palace. The room was small but perfectly adequate for a short stay. The staff were very helpful but you need to be aware that their English is not perfect specially when quoting a price. It's worth getting them to write it down.They are not great at giving directions, we got lost a couple of time coming out of the hotel as they told us to go one way but we should have gone the other. Would stay there again despite these very small problems.

Had absolutely wonderful stay at Sakura! Literally two minutes walk from Jimbocho Subway station. All the staffs spoke good English and from first day they provided me good hospitality. Highly recommended

Stayed for two nights and found staff very kind and friendly. The hotel is very clean and the cafe has the atmosphere that is like overseas'. One of them, Kaz helped me a lot on everything in the hotel and the neighborhood area. I suddenly decided to stay at this hotel, but he arranged my stay very nicely. It was so great to see such a kind staff like him that I'm coming backing again for sure. The hotel is really clean and the location leaves nothing to be desired.

Such a caring, friendly hostel. It was really clean, the staff were so helpful. It’s in a great location with a lovely cafe. The beds are very comfy and great showering facilities. Really enjoyed staying here.

Stayed here for 8 days during the summer with my girlfriend and would reccomend it to absolutely anyone who is traveling to Tokyo and doesn’t want the accomodation to break their budget.Superb location:2 min walk to Jimbocho station which directly connects you to central parts of Tokyo like Shinjuku, Shibuya, Akihabara.Staff:Super friendly and helpful staff that speak good English.Facilities:Bathrooms and toilets on each floor shared by several rooms. Never had to stand in line once during my stay and they were very clean.Basement had a washing machine and thumble dryer for 400 yen combined per wash.Bedroom was spacious enough to open your luggage and get dressed for 2 people. This seems to be a luxury in the majority of accommodation within same price range.Breakfast starts at 4pm till 11pm which is great. It’s quite basic but good enough to get your day started. Have to pay extra for eggs but only 160 yen.All in all it was a great stay while in Tokyo and the staff was super accommodating and made our stay very relaxing.Thank you all staff of Sakura Hotel Jimbocho!

I´m writing this review on day 8 of our great stay at Sakura Jimbocho. ROOMThe room was clean and minimal with a very comfy bed and duvet, dark blackout curtains and one shelf for hanging things. There is a TV but it is in such a position that you would never use it. There was enough room to put a suitcase in a corner and unpack our belongings out the way on the large shelf above the door. The room comes with a kimono and slippers which was nice to wear when chilling. We rented towels for $1 each. Rooms are cleaned every day. The shared bathroom was no issue at all for us as the showers and toilets are in their own sound-proof private cubicles meaning that you get full privacy once inside. Plus they are always very clean. In 8 days of bathroom use I never had to wait to use a shower/toilet.StaffThe staff are great- my personal favourites were Peter and Naomi, but all of them were nice and accommodating. Food The food in the cafe below was quite impressive! I couldn´t believe the taste of the arroz con mariscos for a low budget hotel cafe - just as good as what I´ve eaten in Spanish seaside cities like Cadiz. They have a great range of international dishes and Japanese food and you can get a cooked meal at any time 24/7 - amazing! The breakfast offered with the room was amazing value and I liked that it was self-serve. It includes tea, coffee, juice, toast, butter, jam, marmalade or other spreads, and soup. After a while I got sick of eating bread (I normally eat fewer carb than Japanese diet) and started ordering eggs for around $1.50 instead and having the soup - great!!All in all I would 100% come back to this hotel next time I come back to Tokyo. It is more than enough for our needs, great English-speaking staff, cool vibe and comfy rooms! Also left us enough cash to blow like crazy in Tokyo!! Arigatou gozaimasu!! :)

This place is perfect if you just need a night stay or multiple nights. The staff are friendly and can speak English. The futon in the bunk beds was comfortable and the room was clean. The option of using the drink bar or having breakfast in the cafe area are also nice bonuses.

rooms are very clean, though shared bathrooms, it is well maintained. plus we have daily breakfast of breads, spreads, teas, coffees, juices and soda. receptionists are all helpful. location is accessible to train station

very friendly hotel, staff kindly, and activity special so good for the people first time trip in japonthe room is clean, and all is good. the experience yukata was excelent for the young people who like the culture traditionnel japonnaise

We wanted something different than typical hotel and we got it! :) Staff was so helpful and friendly.They guided us to where to go and what to do. hotel location is perfect, you can go to akihabara by walk and there is metro station nearby. Many eating places and conveniece stores close to sakura hotel. This was our best hotel where we have ever been. And the staff always asked how we are doing and we had lots of fun when we just spoke with them and shared some jokes:)

I think that the staffs in Sakura hotel are very friendly. I especially appreciate the help of Mr. Sato. Mr. Sato is a very friendly and kindly staff. Sometimes I want to take a hot bath. Maybe the hotel can add a bath tub in the future^^

I was in Tokyo for about two weeks for a summer course at nearby Meiji University, and I chose to stay at the hostel because it had everything I needed at a good price. The staff are very accommodating and they speak English well (especially Peter!), the shared bathrooms are always clean, the other guests I met were all nice, the 24/7 cafe has a decent selection of food and drinks, they accept major credit cards, and they have 24/7 manned reception, so coming home late at night wasn't a problem at all. They also have laundry and dryer machines in case you need to do your laundry. The hotel is about a 4-5 minute walk from the closest train station, which makes everything accessible, plus the neighborhood is safe. I would definitely recommend staying in the hostel here (Colt Room for males) if you're a solo traveler on a budget, it's well worth your money. It was my first time traveling alone, and staying here made the accommodation part easy and pleasant. I'd stay here again if ever I come to visit.

This is one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed. The staff is friendly and the breakfast is great! Above all, I love the fact that it is situated in a quiet area yet still accessible to almost every popular spots in Tokyo!

Stayed in in May 2019 in a semi-double room. I highly recommend the place for foreigners because of its convenient and safe location and the staff are friendly and speak English well. Some other things:- Clean facilities. Shared bathroom is well maintained regularly and near the rooms. - Staff were nice enough to let us leave our bags temporarily even after we checked out so we can eat lunch before going to the airport.- Hotel is about a 3-5 min walk from the nearest station which is very convenient especially at night. Area is pretty safe so that's a big plus.- There is a convenience store near the hotel but the hotel itself has a cafe that's open 24/7 which is very nice and convenient.- Room(semi-double) was a smaller than we expected but not too cramped. Just enough for two people.- Buffet breakfast consists of bread, soup with unlimited drinks/coffee. Not really the buffet that we expected but we loved the bread toppings that they had. You can order meals in their cafe but it's not included in the free breakfast.Just want to make one suggestion regarding the door near the counter of the hotel. Please make the door open on one side only if possible(on the side of the counter) because there was one time when one of the staff was rushing to go through the door and we were almost hit by it so maybe it would be better if it only opens and closes inward to avoid any accidents in the future :)Nevertheless, this is definitely a place we would easily go back to.

Location is great! Visited Tokyo 2x this summer - once a party of 5; next a party of 2 - both times Sakura staff was GREAT! They are so friendly and knowledgeable about what’s around. Rooms are small but that’s to be expected. Laundry facilities are so-so - only 2 washers and 2 dryers and the dryers don’t work all that well - takes a long time to dry clothes - be prepared to wait an hour for dry clothes. Breakfast is simple but good - kids really loved the soups! All around a very comfortable stay!

I had my two daughters and I staying together and we had a room large enough for all of us. We loved the location. The rooms were so nice and clean. I highly recommend this hotel. We shared the showers and toilets. All very clean and nice. i liked the cafe, The service was excellent. Happy to stay there again, I will return.

The best hotel/Hostel for a practical traveller without fancy ideas of living . I have used Sakura for ten ore more times . Always friendly personal .Good organisation , Clean rooms and toiletts/showers, 24 hours coffy/eating shop . Fairly Close to subway at least the Jimbucho . Asaksa a little longer. Strongly recomended . POye Sweden

地下の女性専用ドミトリーに泊まりました。立地、スタッフサービス、設備等ホステルとしては充分なものでした。ただ一つ、部屋がカビ臭い。部屋の備え付けのソファにも清潔感が感じられなかった。宿泊施設である以上、ここが快適で無ければダメでしょう。I stayed woman only dormitory.The facilities and staff of hostel were very good.But the room is moldy.

it was my third time in Sakura hotel and I can always recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good price alternative. hotel staff friendly as usually and rooms are clean! plus point is the location in almost the centre of Tokyo with short ways in every direction.

We spent two nights at Sakura Hotel Jimbocho in a private twin room. The room is great and spacious enough for us. We also enjoyed the hotel’s simple breakfast. What we love the most is the location. The hotel is only a few steps away from book streets where many Japanese and foreign language novels/texts are offered at great price! The only downside based on our experience was our encounter with some noisy and inconsiderate guests who chitchatted noisily on corridor although it was already past midnight. Even for my partner who falls asleep easily couldn’t sleep until they stopped talking (at around 1 a.m.). It is not the hotel’s false though, and other guests seem nice and well-mannered.

If you travel a lot and this is not your first time in Tokyo, why don’t you come to Jimbocho ? This is such a special town about curry and books. A lot of books. And to enjoy this amazing city, this is your place to stay. They are all friendly staff and hotel is clean. I arrived here rainy day but it was easy to find because it’s close to the subway station.

I was overthinking a lot in choosing a hotel in 2017 when I first visited Japan. After my 1st trip I made sure to always choose Sakura Hotel for my hotel whenever I come to Japan. Since when I first walked In I was surprised how well they can speak English. (Almost native level). Many staffs speak many other languages well too. I stayed in both the single rooms and shared rooms. Both choices are good. Tvs in the single rooms. They clean the sheets every night. They have a washer and dryer on the bottom floor for 300 yen to clean and 100 yen to dry. The biggest positive of this hotel is it’s 24 hours and the cafe area is 24 hours. The cafe is quite popular among Japanese. Many come to the cafe even though they don’t stay at the hotel. You can have a coffee 2am if you wish. Free breakfast is good. Toast and coffee. Butter, jam, cream, sugar available. You can add egg to your toast for 300 yen. Not many offer this kind of service for for the price you pay for your room. The hotel runs events every couple weeks and have a jogging event every week. It’s a great way to meet new people also staying at the hotel as well as getting to know the staff. Overall always recommend coming here.

It s probably the cheapest place in tokyo to stay if you look for a room and not a capsule nor dormitory. It seems old, and very tiny. Even a capsule has more rooms for your luggages. Unless you stay by yourselves. I was with my daughter and we have to park our luggages outside at the lobby.The staff was helpful but strict. It was 3 am in the morning when i asked for a towel. My bait didnt read it that the we must to RENT the towel and other amenities. And even though it was really late they wont give it unless i pay it right away... i mean we talk about only 100 yen. The same thing when i borrowed their extra key because i forgot to bring when i tooo a shower. They insisted to give the extra key back directly after i got in to the room. It was 2 am in the morning. Mean they can wait until morning no? So for me i found them not flexible when it was only small things, when they can help and treat us more nicely. I have this impression perhaps because i stayed in another place before capsul motel and they are more friendly and flexible and really helpful.Oh and no jet shower unlike mostly closet in japan, in some toilet in some level (mine level 2).Location is ok. Safe. Clean enough. Hope this review helpful.

It was nice to stay at Sakura hotel Jimbocho. It is close to the subway. But be mindful that there is no lift to go up. Thus, you will have a small exercise (take your luggage up through the stairs). Overall, I think it is worth every penny to stay at Jimbocho.

Extremely convenient location. The staff is very friendly and speak English. The rooms are clean and a fresh yukata every day in June is a nice touch. Would be nice to see a wider choice of options for breakfast.

It was clean, comfortable, has a strategic area, and overall very good! The breakfast was also very nice. Although the overall price is a bit more expensive, it was worth it and id come back here if i ever travel to Tokyo again. Thank you for the nice stay!

I love the price and simplicity of this place. The room is well kept though sometimes the noise outside could be heard inside the room especially at night. Overall, I still like this place and the convenience to all station.

Location is excellent if you want to be close to the action, but not so close that you can't get any peace and quiet when you need it. The staff was super awesome and attentive. Free breakfast was an unexpected, but ultimately great surprise. I would definitely come back here any time I'm back in Tokyo. Only a couple minutes walk from the subway, but if you don't mind a little bit of walking you could easily make it to the Imperial Palace, Ginza, Tsukiji and Ameyoko from here.

I stayed at Sakura Hotel for 2 weeks, good location, 24h cafe, close to metro, clean rooms, laundry room, friendly staff ready to help you with everything you need. I totally recommend this place!!!!!

Small hotel but full of good mood and interedting things. You can stay here very good price but can be satisfied more. Also very comfortable to go any place in tokyo.You can get much information materials here for free.

Great place with good price, it’s at 15 min walking from the jr line, the staff is awesome and they speak a lot of different languages. One of the best things I liked is that it’s open 24 hours so you can check in at any time. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good place with a good price :)

Rooms are small, but it's Tokyo everything is small. It's in a great location and the staff is the best and multilingual which is super convenient. There is also a 24 hour cafe and plenty of resources about what to do in Japan.

All of the staff are super friendly and exceptional in their language skills. If you speak a major world language they are sure to be able to help you. The staff size is kind of small but that let's you get to know them all. Next time I come to Japan I'm staying here.

Excellent service and employees at our disposal (I was able to switch my room because I had a condemned window). Very good atmosphereVery clean room and lavatoryVery well localisedExcellent food and drink

Had a pleasant stay this weekend. Service was excellent and rooms were clean. These are two things that I look for in any accommodation when I travel. The breakfast included was enough start a long day of travel.

I had stayed here before three years ago, and decided to give it another shot. I had forgotten how easy it was to get to nearly anywhere in Tokyo because there were so many train lines that intersected at Jimbocho Station. It made it very easy for me to meet up with different friends from all over the city.The best past was the awesome crew that runs this hotel. They’re not just helpful, but they’re always genuinely happy to see you.Will definitely return here for my next weekend in Tokyo.

Friendly, helpful staff, comfy beds, quiet rooms, just a block from 3 subway lines. A great place for budget travellers! The hotel’s café is a welcoming gathering place for locals and guests from all over. And the breakfast of soup and toasts was a perfect way to start our day. We’ll be back!

We lived staying at Sakura. I fellIn love with their Paris and Tokyo plates!!! I’d live to buy a set as a souvenir. Great comfy beds and excellent bathroom facilities. We pretty much had the floor to ourselves. Yummy soup for breaky.

Stayed there in May for 2 days. The room was basic but cute and clean. The basics like Yukata, face towels etc. are provided. Bathrooms are shared but they are super clean.The staff was very friendly and supportive. They organized events, like a city run with a party afterwards. We made some friends and really enjoyed it.

a very good journey and enjoy these all nights, there are so many kind staff even one of Taiwanese I felt so friendly. everything there are good. some nights will have special event, very leisure. room all clean and comfortable

Jimbocho Jewel. Excellent location to move around and explore Tokyo. Friendly And hepful staff. Also the guest is offered with different options and tips for day tours and other activities. You should not miss this incredible place

The position very close to Jimbocho subway is strategic to visit the city and the kindness of the staff was perfect. Reception and bar open h24; the room was very small but the hotel offers good-value for money. I racommend it!

Sakura Hotel Jimbocho is the perfect place to stay in Tokyo. The hotel is clean, comfy and very affordable. They have great location which is near stations, restaurants and convenient stores. The staff are accommodating, friendly and kind, especially Peter Chen who makes sure that our stay is memorable. We will definitely choose Sakura Hotel Jimbocho again!

That was a very Nice week,rooms are Nice And a very good work from the staff ,they are very kind and they help you with smile and call for reservation fir restaurant for you I recommand a lot of you can go to it

This hotel has a great location close to Jimbocho metro station. Rooms are neat clean and silent. Shower areas are also impecable. Peter and the staff are amazing and we learned that there are Spanish- Japanese speaking clubs that gather every other afternoon in the cafe on the first floor. You can buy the 24h, 48h & 72h metro card at the reception (other locations where you can buy it are the international airports and Tokyo station). Tip of the day: the closest Metro exit is A1 and yes there is an Elevator that takes you from Metro level to street Level. Thank you Sakura Hotel! After a few nights at Sakura hotel we left to Kyoto and then came back to Tokyo. As we stepped back into this hotel it felt like coming back home! 100% recommended!

We had a good time staying at hotel jimbocho. Strategic location. Near 2mins walk to subway station. Breakfast is very simple but effective in preparing for the long tiring day..staff was very friendly and accomodating

Stuff was very nice and kind ready to help you anytime. Our room was clean but unfortunately not too quiet - some rooms are right next to bathrooms which could be disturbing especially during the night.It was also not possible to open the window which in a 2x2m room could be anoying.With addition charge of 160¥ you can get very good omelete for breakfast.In my opinion this is a good choice for travelers on budget who just need to sleep in some clean and confortable place.

Staffs are friendly and talkative. The location is near by Metro, it's an important point when travel. The room we lived is clean, bright and safe. Breakfast is not bad but not very good, but after all, it’s free.

The amenities were great and rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely knowledgeable and very helpful for non Japanese speaking guests. The hotel is centrally located and close to trains and taxis. There was a cute cafe in the lobby with drinks and food anytime. The rooms were very quiet at night and made for a great night’s sleep.

Aside from providing all of the information and amenities I could have possibly needed, Sakura hotel Jimbocho is so conveniently located that I was able to easily access virtually every part of Tokyo! When I wasn't out enjoying the city, I was able to relax in the cozy atmosphere of the hotel where Peter and the rest of the staff were always so friendly and helpful.

Sakura Hotel Jimbocho is a very nice budget hotel which the location are close to the metro station As well. I only realize that we left our thing at their hotel after we back to our country.Peter found it and help to postage back to us. Really appreciate the help from them! The people there are really nice.

I can say Sakura Jimbocho is the perfect choice for alone or friends trip. Perfect acommodation, best team working for our satisfaction. Clean and organized installations. I am loving to stay here. Domo arigato gosaimasu all de crew!

i came for my last schedule at tokyo, the hotel was so clean and it’s convenient for solo travelers. although i got at basement floor but it was so quiet. the toilet was clean. the staffs were so helpful

Very nice and quite place to stay in Tokyo. The metro S-Line station is about 150m to walk. The staff speaks english and is very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is included but just minimal, enough to start in a new awesame day.

Location is near train station, clean and cozy environment with breakfast provided. I enjoyed my stay and the staff are friendly and accomodating. If given a chance to visit Japan again, I would gladly stay again in this hotel. Thanks for the great experience.

I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel! From the moment I walked inside I felt very welcomed. The staff is really incredible! Arigato gozaimasu everyone for your hard work to make my stay in Japan so pleasant! The rooms are clean, the neighbourhood is quiet but it's still close to the city center! I definitely recommend Sakura Hotel Jimbocho to everyone visiting Tokyo! I'll be back!

The staff in this hotel was very friendly, the showers where clean and the servive was great. The location is great if you want to visit Tokyo and they even organize some events. Another big plus is that they are used to internationals so they can help you if tou can't speak Japanese.

I stayed in a double room on the fifth floor. Location is good and breakfast is provided. However, there were only 2 shower rooms on the fifth floor so we had to queue and wait for our turn. The room is small but the size of the bed was okay.

It's a nice budget hotel with great food. Strategic place, it's only 4min from subway station. Jimbocho station has 3 lines going to different tourist attractions. The double room is good enough for a couple. Shared bathroom is not bad after all. It is clean and well maintained.

This was our first night in Tokyo and the sweet staff of Sakura Hotel as well as its charming front and interior made us feel home right away. Peter was perfectly fluent in English and explained everything to us clearly and friendly. The double room isn’t huge but very comfortable, shampoos, shower gel, bathrobes and slippers were provided for free and the bath and showers were very clean! In the breakfast room you can choose from a variety of drinks and small dishes. All together a great place to stay for not much money!

The room is very cosy and the hotel itself is not far away from the city center. The staff is really nice and the service is very good as well. Everything is super clean. Definitely worth the price! Would stay here again!

Nice hotel and hostel in book town, Tokyo.A few blocks of Jimbocho station.The welcome was great. Friendly and helpful staff.I recomend this hostel for solo travelers.In short, everything. It was our best stay so far.

I arrived early in the morning and the staff were very happy to assist, checking in and out was easy and the place was clean. Location is great, two minutes from Jimbocho Station and one minute to Seven Eleven which was a welcome sight.

Well, the title says it all! The place was perfect for my stay in Tokyo.The whole experience was very nice.The staff was very friendly and smiley. Always helping, giving good tips about places to visit and Tokyo. I could even borrow a bike from them so I was able to see the city from a different point of view!There are always things going on on their cafe, to hang around and meet people (and try to learn japanese :)The rooms were perfect for good deep sleep and the showers excellent!The place was very clean.I will definitively stay here in my next trip to Tokyo!Thank you Sakura Hotel Jimbocho!!

Excellent showers. Beds are a bit hard but overall great had a few snorers but nothing a bit of drinking won’t fix. Friendly staff with amazing service. Close to town very centred to see all the sites.

Our group thoroughly enjoyed the time spent at Sakura Hotel Jimbocho. For us it was the perfect location and allowed us access to many of Tokyo’s wonderful sites. Having breakfast on site was also super helpful, as we were able to eat before beginning our busy days. The hotel was clean and quiet at night. It was just the perfect place for us!

The location is great, clean and all the staffs are so friendly. They are also multi-lingual and their staffs comes from all over the world. It is a hotel that I will recommend to everyone from solo to family travelers. Extremely value for money. The ground floor cafe also serves good and cheap meals. Although you should be aware that toilets are shared and toiletries comes at an extra cost.

I stayed in Sakura Hotel Jimbocho for 1 week, and the place is extremely convenient, cozy and with easy access. The staff is super friendly and they´re fluent in many languages!! I´ve stayed here 2 times already and it never disappoints me! I´ll definitely be back!

Perfect service! Verry clean. I appreciated everything about the service. I would highly recommend coming to this place for a night or 2. You will no be disapointed if you come here. Tokyo is a beautiful city too.

A hotel suitable for young traveler and save moneys, near Jimbocho stationNot a lot of choice for breakfast but it's okIt should be better if you carry more of clothes in January (just a Asian traveler like me)

Staff is very polite! And the hotel is clean and comfortable! To stay in Tokyo, this is a good choice!There is a cafe inside of this hotel, you can have a nice meal or coffee!When I arrived, it’s just started raining! It was a good and warm just to hanging out there while waiting for the rain to stop.

What made our stay particularly enjoyable was the very friendly and helpful staff and the relaxed atmosphere in the café area adjacent to the reception. So much better than staying in an up-market but less personable hotel.

The hotel is very conveniently located in the middle of Tokyo in this quiet and sophisticated neighborhood of Jimbocho, only 250m walking distance to the nearest subway means you can get to your destination within half and hour or so. The breakfast is simple but very tasty, especially the soup. Although shared toilet and bathroom, we didn't find that we have to fight the space with other residents. This hotel also organised many events in which we greatly enjoyed one of the event. Next time when I come to Tokyo again, I will not be hesitate to choose Sakura Jimbocho again.

This place is one of our favorites, all the staff was amazing, friendly and kind. Peter who speaks like 45 languages was really helpful. Don’t spect a super big breakfast it’s a normal breakfast for Tokyo it’s light but delicious. The room was really clean and the showers and CR were also sparkling clean. Have a really good location really near the metro station. We wanted to stay more nights but they were fully booked. Thank you for everything!!Xoxo

Sakura Jimbocho is the place to stay in Tokyo. Central but kind of quite area, very friendly and helpful staff, nice interaction with other guests, afordable, and you get what you pay for in terms of bedroom. Highly recommend

I spent six nights here over the last few days of 2018 and the first few of 2019. Here are the aspects that affected my rating:The price is low and the staff is helpful.The rooms are almost unbearably small.The breakfast is just toast and a cup of coffee.The wifi-connection is provided by a single router and cannot handle several people connecting to it at the same time. There are no toilets or bathrooms in the rooms; they are shared by everyone on a floor.I think Sakura might be a good place to stay for a night or two, but I don't suggest it for longer stays.

A very welcoming, friendly and clean facility located in a convenient location to local stations and general sights around Tokyo. The size of the bed, especially for a room for 2 adults, was very small and unfortunately made for an uncomfortable night of sleep but all features and utilities were great.
