review_body: Great place, quite afordable, very well located, and in a much less busy area. Staff super friendly, and helpful. Beside all of this they also organize small workshops, and gatherings with people from diferent nacionalities. Relaxed and young athmosphere. Thumbs up!!

We stayed there for two nights, and we loved it! Sakura Hotel Jinbocho was really cozy and clean. The location is very quiet and very easy to get to subway. We stayed in a twin room. The room was big enough for us. All the staff was super friendly and welcoming. We will definitely go back there again.We loved their Sakura Cafe too, because they have variety of beers and food. Thank you Sakura Hotel Jinbocho!!!

Sakura Hotel JImbocho is our home away from home whenever we visit Tokyo. The reservation process is smooth. The welcome is warm, and the service is extremely accommodating. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Had a friend introduced me to this place, it is a staff friendly and muti-languague hostel. The price is reasonable, it had 24 hrs staffing and also the manager Peter is a great host, he can speak multiple languages and down to earth. Always willing to help and provide the best services. Will definitely come back.

The place is like in the center of Tokyo. It is very close and accessible to subway. The room is quite small but overall it is a nice room. The room is cleaned everyday unless you place the “Don’t disturb” on the door. All the staff were very friendly.

It was our first family trip to overseas. So, we took the trip seriously by exploring on TripAdvisor. With the budget comparison, we decided to take this hotel as our first choice. Thanks to TripAdvisor n the reviews to make our trip very fruitful.

To those budget travelers, this hotel ticks all the boxes. The basics were provided and enough for good stay in Tokyo. To me, the best part is it's close to metro station - that means it's cheaper to roam around. I highly recommend purchasing the unlimited metro and subway pass and you'll save a ton roaming in Tokyo. You can get it online or via the hotel itself. Another surprising fact about this hotel is it serves delicious food at a very affordable price. On the other hand, don't expect you'll get everything in this hotel such as bidet in the toilet and smaller rooms as compared to other hotels around Tokyo. To me it's ok.

The hotel is in a good position: very close to a metrò station and the imperial park is only a 1 km, there you can run safely with a lots of people. Moreover the hotel organises every week to run together

We didn't stay at the hotel, only stopped in for lunch one day. We actually stumbled upon this place while in route to another restaurant, and I'm glad we found it. The food is very reasonably priced, cooked to order, and is very good! We had the Japanese curry and also the poutine, both delicious. Even my mother, who isn't a big fan of curry, loved it. Will definitely be back!

Stayed in a private room with friends. Only face towel and toothbrush are provided, no bath towel but rental is available. Quite a nice place, room and shower rooms are clean. Basic toast bread for breakfast. No fridge in the room but you can place things in their small fridge. Easy to get to via subway but if you're using JR pass not recommended for the location. About 12 min walk to the nearest JR line.

I highly recommend this place: it's very well situated next to public transport, people are super nice and polite, the price-quality ratio is perfect, hotel very clean. I will come back here with pleasure

We highly recommend it!The hotel staff were really helpful and enjoyable! The hotel's location is perfect for traveling all over Tokyo : you're near the metro, and you can go easily everywhere! Feel free to go there!

I went there in the beginning of year. The location is perfect, only 10 minutes from Shinjuku. The staffs are very polite and helpful, they are multilingual. Highly reccomend!!Will surely come back with my family n friends next time!

Sakura Jimbocho is always my best choice when I decided to travel to Tokyo. Other than it’s handy location, the staffs are very friendly and helpful as well.This might be the best place to stay in Tokyo if you like books, cats, coffee, and also there are many fine and affordable fine restaurants around. Last but not least, subway is the best way to get around Tokyo and it’s just 2-3 mins walk from the hostel.

Good location to transfer with Metro. (Nearest JR Station was Suidobashi)Cleaning room everyday and you can use a Yukata that Hotel prepare.Staffs very good.Quiet place and location.There are convenience store and diner near the hotel.

As a solo traveler, it's been an amazing place to go back to after a long day of traveling. The room is small, nice and just right. Bathroom and toilet are one step out of the door. Very nice service. Good breakfast with toast butter jam and tea (you can add deliciously scrambled eggs for a few yen).

The staff here have been very helpful and accommodating throughout my stay. The room is satisfactory for the price, and very clean and comfy. And the location of the hotel itself is excellent for touring around the city. Thank you!

Value for money stay. What a great find of a good location hotel 2 stations away from Tokyo station. Friendly staff ready to help. The room is decent size and definitely comfortable. I get a good sleep. I can easily explore Tokyo from Jimbocho station as it is not too complicated as other bigger ones

Stayed for one week in a three person room with breakfast. Simple breakfast provided but the service was superb. The staff is extremely helpful to provide assistance on any inquiry especially the last day when I am trying to book an airport limousine on last minute. Will recommend to others.

Great location; one line straight to Shibuya and Tokyo station. I love that is 24hrb access. Walls sound insulation between rooms are great. Relaxing vibe. Beds are comfortable, cannot ask for more with the price.

Room and shower/bathroom was very clean and comfortable. Staff are very helpful and good in speaking English. Location is accessible and near transportation :) Breakfast served is good (loved the unlimited toast and ANY/ALL drinks)

I had a great time. It was comfortable, clean and pleasant. The warm and welcoming ambiance that greets you when you check and check-out leaves a wonderful feeling. Will definitely come back when I get to visit Tokyo again. Thank you to the staff who were always smiling. :)

The location is not so close to Rappongi (discoteques) or Shibuya (bar and restaurant) but if you are looking for a place to sleep for sightseeing Tokyo during the day is very good, because the underground stop is very close and there are cheap supermarkets near by

Hotel staff are all nice and accommodating especially their manager. Room is small but clean. Toilet and showers are tidy. Breakfast is simple but unlimited! We love their daily soup too. Highyl recommended!

A good place to setup base for your travels in Tokyo. A good price for a room; I booked a single bed room which worked great for me. Helpful staff and easy to communicate with. Plenty of restaurants nearby including the hotel. For mass transit, Jimbocho station is located right next door and it is a very good station as it is an express line stop and an interchange for train lines heading to all directions (use the western exits as they are closer to the hotel). I would use Sakura Hotel Jimbocho again for my base of operations in traveling around Tokyo.

Our stay was well enjoyed, we love the close location to the nearest metro station and the ease and comfort of the hotel. The staff was very cordial and helpful even if it was down to the easiest request of just a glass of ice, they never disappoint. The rooms as just as described and there were no surprises. I would definitely recommend this to friends looking for a good value for money stay in Tokyo.

We have stayed at this hotel on four occasions now over the past 15 years. It has never changed! The area around is also just the same! This is a very small hotel. The staff make you feel very welcome. The rooms are small and have bunk beds but they are clean and more than adequate for our needs. The showers are shared. Breakfast is often included which consists of toast and a drink this was nice.. but often too busy for us to oartake. So if you would like breakfast - perhaps have it early. Jimbocho station is very well located to get around Tokyo and is just a three minute walk from the hotel. We had a room on the ground floor this time, the only small issue was that on Saturday night there was a karaoke session on in the bar which was very loud. Luckily it all shut down at 10pm and allowed us to get a good night’s sleep.

Highly recommended. We found Sakura Hotel Jimbocha, Tokyo better than we had expected. It's a great place to stay. Highlights for the reasonable price are: nice clean rooms and comfortable beds, clean showers & toilets, really close to the Jimbocha metro, cafe is convenient, and very helpful reception staff I've dealt with on 2 shifts since our arrival.

My room is small and cozy. This hotel also has a coin washer and dryer so that made it easy. Almost everything is walking distance from The Tokyo Dome, Korakuen Hall, The Imperial Palace gardens and the Nippon Budokan. Restaurant are of walking distance as well especially with Yoshinoya, Mos Burger and Izakaya bars. Suidobashi station is just 16 minutes away (walking distance) up north so that’s super. Akihabara is only a 12 minute cab drive away and Sensō-ji only a 18 minute cab drive away as well. The Ryogoku Kokugikan is a 30 minute walk and 13 minute cab drive heading east. All in all it’s super affordable and easy to get where I was headed in my Puroresu trip this year. I would recommend for anyone on a tight budget on there trip to Tokyo. I will definitely book again in the future!

It is pretty easy to locate the hotel. Its a super and friendly place to stay and dine. It is clean, bed is comfy. Price is reasonable for budget travel. Staff are helpful and they also prepare simple breakfast with free coffee refill (tats what we need in the morning)! Another thing public transport is just a corner away

We had two kids living together. Room is very small but this was traveling not long living, a clean and safe room is critical than others. Breakfast was simple, toast and coffee/soda drinks/tea bags and one hot soup. I love tea bags. Various choice with good flavor. But the hot water only one themos, frequently suffered shortage.

I discovered a funny charming place with a very helpful staff. Lots of touristic info available and close to metro Jjmbocho. Delicious restaurant. Bed and bath room all comfort. Very good price quality rate. I definitively recommend!

Stayed here once for 2016 Summersonic and stayed here again for Paul McCartney concert. Amazing value-for-money hotel, clean rooms, cool lobby playlist, cool staff, and a 24 hour bar with a great selection of beer! All in all, a super comfortable stay!

Very close to the subway station and convenient store. There’s also a lot of restaurants nearby. Breakfast was ok but just enough before I started my day. I enjoyed staying here and might consider to come back here again

This place is perfect for backpackers. Very near to station and convenience store. Quiet area and the staff are very friendly. Worth for money. Setback only the space. Perhaps no bed is better for couple rooms.

Found this place on google looking to book a hotel for cheap, booked 10 days for a really good price. The rooms have all the basic amenities (tv, air conditioning coat hangers, mirrors, etc. ) , there's free wi-fi and the place provides free breakfast. The bathrooms and toilets are shared. The staff understands English and are very nice and professional.

Pros:I take around 3 mins walk to go to Jimbocho metro station, it's really convenient, and the area is full of old books stores, which are worth to visit, like treasure hunting.Staff are helpful, if the room is ready, you will be allowed to check in early, they provide water with mint, it taste actually really good!The public area is lovely, it's great to have some beer there.Cons: WiFi is slow.Maybe because that my room is on the ground floor, I can hear doors open/close all the time.It only have 1 toilet and shower on the ground floor, sometimes you are gonna have to wait, or just go to another floor.Even if you put on "do not disturb" tag on the door, they still come and clean up the room.The breakfast are all the same, tost bread.

Had a very nice bunk bed room, on 5th floor, first days all ok, other guests paid attention to be quiet and also leave the shower rooms clean. Which unfortunately changed the last two nights. Depends always who‘s staying there at the same time. Hotel staff did everything to make one comfortable! Very close to the underground. Simple but totally ok breakfast. Only down side was that windows couldn‘t be opened in the room - and the noice of the hairdryers until midnight!!

Overall, I was very satisfied. Staff was very polite, breakfast totally ok, very conveniently located and connected via underground. Just wish some of the fellow guests would have „behaved“a bit better, and been more quiet at night and also not left the public showers & bathroom facilities in a mess!

Jimbocho's Sakura Hotel is a good hotel with low prices and goods rooms. The hotel is near of a subway's station who deserves shibuya and shinjuku directly. The staff is very nice and helpfull. And for the gamers the hôtel is near of Akihabara.

Very helpful and friendly staff, and a welcoming atmosphere. Beer and food at the bar. Great location to see Ueno park, Akihabara and the imperial palace. Showers are clean and beds are comfortable too which helps after long flights!

We stayed in a private room -- reasonable priced, comfortable and clean. Wonderful, helpful staff who answered all of our questions. Breakfast and coffee were included in our room rate and there are lots of other amenities available (luggage storage, laundry) is in a great location (easy access to trains). Would definitely stay here again!

Staffs greet us with smile and very friendly. Very good location and close by everything(restaurants and convenient store). Easy access to subway. Peter and Naomi are great. Room is very clean. Will definitely come back.

It was a lovey experience to stay this hotel. I was impressed the clean room and kind staff. Located convinient place and there are many small / old and good local restaurents are near this place. I would like to stay here next time.

Disappointing hostel with good staff and flawed facilities.Room was brightly lit, loud, and smelled bad. Poor air conditioning made it all the worse and might have caused the mildew smell. Laundry machines worked A-OK. Location is great.

Sakura [-] is a very friendly hotel in a convenient location. The staff is very helpful, and the guests are all on vacation. The scrambled eggs make a great breakfast, and I also recommend the custard!

My first stay in Japan I got to experience wonderful service with great staff at Sakura. So when I decided to find again to Japan my first thought was to go where I liked. I was pleasantly surprised that most of the staff remembered me and greeted me. It was a nice feeling to feel so welcomed. I know my stay will be brief here but I hope others may come to enjoy the warmth of Sakura hostel.

Stayed at Sakura Hotel Jimbocho for 2 weeks in a single room and I was very satisfied with the hotel. It is conveniently located near to Jimbocho station(Shijuku line and Mita line). There are plenty of restaurants nearby. There's also a few convenient stores, pharmacies and bookstores within walking distance. The rooms and amenity provided were great. The staffs speak English and are there 24/7 around the clock if you needed them.Highly recommended :)

The location of hotel is so convient nearby imperial palace and you can walk to Tokyo station. The rooms are clean and tidy, moreover the workers are so friendly, helpful that I never wanna leave there and stay there forever. There are so many activites and parties that you will never get bored and meet new people, but it is also quite at night. It has cafe which you can have your meal, drink and the deserts are so delicious.

One of the best budget rooms available in Tokyo. Really friendly staff who were really helpful and speak amazing English. Rooms are small and simple, with shared bathrooms but are spotlessly clean. The sleeping kimono is a cute extra perk too!

The Sakura Hotel Jimbocho is a lovely hotel in the heart of Tokyo! The surrounding area is full of restaurants, cafes, bookshops, and bars. It is also conveniently close to Jimbocho station so catching trains and making your way round is relatively easy. The best part by far are the staff, who all gave excellent and friendly service!

Great staff. Very friendly, welcoming and helpful.Peter, Naomi and Kanae were spot on with their advice.Very clean rooms with comfortable beds.Good basic breakfast to kick start the day.Got room upgraded easily.Great value for money.Less than 5 minutes walk to Jimbocho station.The experience at Sakura was way beyond expectations. Well done :)

We went for some extra days in Tokyo and the terrasse is so cool, prices are amazing and very helpful staff always there for you! The neighbourhood is calm and full of good food places. By the way you can meet easily a lot of people from a lot countries!

The room reservation process was easy and there were no hiccups. The room and the hotel itself was clean and functional. The wi-fi worked and there was even a washer and drier on site. And an ironing board and iron. Staff were not only friendly -- they were also helpful! The location is also convenient. This is not a place for luxury travelers planning to vacation in their hotel. It's perfect, however, for a shower, a bed, and a a friendly smile.

Great hostel with very welcoming staff and a very affordable cafe at the entrance that serves food all day. The beds were very comfy and the curtains allowed for privacy. Also only a two minute walk from the nearest tube station.

The cooler in my room did a lot of noise without providing such a good cooling. In the first floor rooms, noise can be heard from people going to the toilets, taking showers or even using the air dryer after midnight (which is against the rules). Other than that, the reception is very friendly, the included breakfast at the café is nice if you like continental breakfast and the stay was overall very good.

Clean room, Good location, a little bit narrow room. The staff are very helpful. It will be great if breakfast would have more kinds of food other than just bread and jam. Overall, this place is value for money.

The hotel's staff is helpful and kind. The location of the hotel is great - close to book stores, post office, underground, the Imperial Palace (walk to Tokyo station), a few meters to a 7-eleven, plenty of wending machines just around the corner.

Jimbocho rocks! This hotel is clean & tidy very close to the metro & restaurants. Excellent breakfast and very helpful staff. Bathroom excellent and beds very good. Our room came with air conditioning.

I came here staying one night but immediately booked another night. I loved the people who stayed there and It was in a great area right in the heart of Tokyo. If you come to Tokyo, come here definitely.

I stayed here because of a conference I was attending. The place has a very casual look, but had everything I needed. The staff is super friendly and most helpful. After the conference I decided to stay here for another 4 days because it was close to the metro, lots of restaurants nearby and it was very central. Would definitely stay here again.

I spent several nights at this hotel in October 2016. One week in medio October and one night in the end of the month. Even the cleaning staff remembered me at my second visit. I can highly recommend it to everyone. The beds are good, and the food is cheap and good. The staff is very nice and really helpful as well. If your a runner they also have running sessions in Tokyo including dinner afterwards. I will surely spend my nights at this hotel at my next visit.Best regardsOle Jacob HagenNorway

As a solo traveler, I found the place really comforting, clean, and affordable. I booked the place online at least 2 days before my stay and I still was able to find a room/bed. It's near Jimbocho station so that's a plus.

We booked in the morning as our air bnb fell through and we booked for 7 of us through booking.com but when we arrived it was only for 4 people, they rearranged everything to fit us in. Great staff. Thank you for all you did, location fantastic, rooms clean, great downstairs bar open 24 hours, excellent breakfast, we had small kids and they also loved it. Will definitely use again next time we are in Japan.

Sakura Hotel Jimbocho is a great decision, you feel at home, and they have a very friendly staff specially Peter this guy is the best.If you have the opportunity to go a Tokyo ,go to Sakura Hotel is a good choice.

Sakura Hotel Jimbocho is wonderfully located in the center of town and conveniently close to transportation facilities. It is also close to an important landmark of Tokyo - the Imperial Palace. The lodging facilities are clean and modern, and the hotel offers excellent WiFi and a good breakfast for free. I was pleasantly pleased with the excellent customer service provided by the staff of the hotel. In particular, Peter, a staff of the hotel, was kind enough to make a reservation (in Japanese) over the phone as the clinic where I was scheduled to have a pre-employment medical check didn't have English speaking staff. I absolutely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Very nice place. It’s halfway between an hotel and hostel. Staff is very nice, especially the chief/owner which is incredibly nice and speaks perfect English. Rooms are 4 beds rooms and beds are capsule-style, so you can get very good sleep there. Comfy bed with light and plugs. Amenities are very good and very clean. The place has a special vibe, pretty warm, it feels a bit like a nice little family hotel. A small restaurant is built in the hotel, and the lobby/common area is also the restaurant room which is nice. Breakfast is very decent, many choices, unlimited servings for most. It’s possible to meet some people there but not too many because the place is pretty small. Limited but present social vibe. In that regard It’s much better than the average hostel in Japan. The location is nothing special, boring neighborhood but walkable distance from Tokyo Imperial Palace. Would come back.

Really friendly staff who spoke very good English. Nice little cafe serving good food and a good breakfast. Rooms were very clean. Good showers. Great location away from the crowds just a couple of minutes walk to the subway, which takes you to Shinjuku in about 10 mins.

Our group loved it– the students also loved this accommodation. It was close to the train station and the staff were also very helpful– breakfast was also very good– the facilities were also very good + clean– the students loved having the café as well!

It's probably been a good 3 years since I last stayed in a hostel (and that last hostel happened to be in Osaka). Even though I usually stay in full-service hotels, I really enjoyed this hostel due to the combination of affordability, convenience, and friendly service.The hostel is located conveniently near the Jimbocho subway station (5 min walk) on a pretty quiet side street. There is plenty of dining and convenience store options nearby, and you really get a native Tokyo feel. It is pretty easy to find with a little cafe up front. Once you walk in, you find a small check-in counter to your right where the front desk staff is friendly and efficient in getting you to your room and answering your questions. The hostel is located close to the imperial palace, yasukuni shrine, and not too far from Tokyo Station / Ginza.I got a single private room with a tiny window (didn't really overlook anything) - enough space for 1 person to not feel claustrophobic but not much bigger than a prison cell. The shared sinks on the floor were clean and easy to use. The showers were comfortable though basic, and there were plenty of bathrooms on each floor. I never had to wait in the morning or at night.

If you’re looking for a place to stay in Tokyo, don’t hesitate it twice! Sakura Hotel Jimbocho is the best choice you can ever make. Friendly staff, amazing atmosphere and delicious food you can find at the open 24hrs restaurant! I stayed with them for three weeks and they made me feel like home.You need to visit them, it worth it :)
寝るだけなので利用しましたが思いのほか良かったです。部屋からシャワーや洗面台トイレまでの距離が近く、スポーツクラブくらい清潔でした！世界のビールが爽やかな値段で楽しめます！clean shower, safe, friendly staff, 4am-11am breakfast, 24 hour-operating cafe. world wide beer is on service.

On top of being a nice, quiet and well-located hotel (very close to the Imperial Palace), there are from time to time social events held in the cafeteria on the first floor.Always nice to meet other travelers or local Japanese looking to exchange culture, travel tips or just practice English and/or Japanese.

The room is clean and the cafe serves great food for 24hours. What makes it better is the staff speak english well, so they could help you with anything you need. Plus, there is elevator to go upstairs in case you bring heavy luggages during your visit!

Very comfortable, extremely friendly in very good price. Suitable for kids too. The neighborhood is super cool with many little cool restaurants and close to a beautiful parc in one side and crazy amusement park on the other.

I generally don't really book Hotels that have shared facilities or dormitory style of rooms, but i was attracted by this property, so i decided to give it a look, and opted for the single room.It has been a great choice, and having the shared facilities was not an issue at all. in 9 days i've never found the bathroom or the shower occupied, so the access was very easy.The staff is also amazing, and super helpful if you need them.

The Hotel is really great and has an amazing staff! They are very helpful and always know how to help you! It is a very nice place and has great accommodations for everything that you need! It is a perfect little hostel/hotel!

The room was very small, there was no comun living room, they don't provide towel, and in the breakfast, which supposedly is included, you have to pay for the milk. Regarding all those inconvenients, I would say it was expensive

We loved this place. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Staff were friendly and very helpful. 8 minutes walk to Jimbocho Subway. Breakfast was basin (toast & butter/ham and coffee/juice). The only downside is a bit noisy because we can hear the sound of other rooms and the common hair dryers at night. Overall is a nice hostel if you are travelling with friends on a budget and dont really care much about the privacy and stuff.

This hotel is clean and well placed for people who wang to spend few days in tokyo. He is located in the ´bouquiniste' quarter. He is near to jimbocho subway station. Breakfast is included and you can have a drink on the terrace !

Nice staffs and cozy bed ( i used 7 female room). Here is closed to attractions, CVS and station. I mostly loved here cuz there are good bistros right around corner.스태프들이 영어도 잘하시고, 일층에서도 식당처럼 운영을 하십니다. 아침ㅅㅏ머거야 하는건 ㅂㄹ지만 그래도 위치 좋고 괜찮은폄인듯 합니다

This hotel is cheap place to stay for people they are just need a clean place to sleep. Toilet and shower are shared. A good place to explore Tokyo. The stuff is very friendly. Breakfast is just toast bread with marmalade , coffee or tea. You will find tourists and backpacker in this place from all over the world.

The locations and staff are perfect. Quiet street and near Jimbocho station. But the room is very noisy because we hear the sound from other rooms and the common hair dryers right in front of our door were often used. The breakfast is so small, we have to pay an extra for eggs!

The location is very convenient and near the station ( subway ). Some convenience stores are around the hotel. Staff is helpful and friendly. All other facilities including toilets and bathrooms are clean.

Excellent staff. Excellent accommodations. Organizes events eg Easter egg hunt when I was there. Great place to stay for short holiday or work trip. Convenient for transport - train station a 5min walk away.

Great place, friendly staff, fantastic location, great price and all guests are here to enjoy Tokyo . Easy place to connect with other backpackers and explore, right beside the imperial palace where you can go for a walk everyday early morning if you are jetleged , cafe food is good great and decent price

I stayed in a dorm at Sakura Hotel Jimbocho for 2 nights. It was all I needed: friendly and helpful staff, clean facilities, 24/7 laundry located at the basement, a simple coffee shop where you can grab a snack and meet new friends. Also, the location is very convinient and accesable.

fabiannawanders
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed for a whole week in a dormitory room and everything went fine: the staff is very nice and helpful, the location is great and you have everything you need in the hotel (food, café, wifi...). Enjoy!

The receptionist speaks english well so it's very helpful. They also nicely recommended places to visit. The location is very near to the station so no worries. And the breakfast is nice for that price. Definitely recommended!

The location was perfect. Easy access to metro and other services. The room was tiny but eh, at that price in Tokyo... Breakfast was ok. Tables could have been cleaner. Wifi worked well. I could complete my work without interruption. Overall, I enjoyed my stay.

The staff at Sakura hotel Jimbocho were the nicest and most welcoming people! Truly made great friendships with them and for that reason I would come again :) The location was another great thing about the stay, easy access to subway which connects to main sites of Tokyo quite easily. The stay is nearby the main areas of Tokyo, too

We travelled to Japan on our honeymoon. The Sakura Hotel Jimbocho was simple, but very fair concerning the location in Tokyo. The staff was awesome and very friendly! We can recommend this hotel to everyone traveling to Tokyo. We stayed here some years ago and finally managed to write the review on TripAdvisor.

I had a nice time staying here. I was here for 9 days, staff was friendly and helpful. I did have the cleaners ignore the do not disturb on the door a few times when i was feeling sick and sleeping in, but apart from that no issue

Spent another pleasant few days this time. The staff is always helpful and friendly. Very centrally located in Tokyo and just a few minutes walk to the Imperial Gardens and Tokyo Dome. I love this place too much.

I did not have a reservation but they had availability and got me in for the night. Very close and easy to find from the Jinbocho subway line. The lobby was open 24hrs and they sold a variety of international and local beers. I opted for a single room on the second floor. The only downfall was that the room I got was next to the stairwell and elevators. And at around 7am when people were leaving the stairwell door kept slamming shut and I couldn’t sleep any longer due to the noise. Otherwise the bed was comfortable and perfect for a solo traveler. Breakfast was a great ¥390! Coffee, toast and homemade soup. The lobby area is small however so if you happen to be getting breakfast with a bunch of other people at the same time you’re gonna have to wait. I would stay here again! (Just would request not to be near the stairwell!)

I came to Tokyo for the first time with five other students for internship program and we were told that we would stay here until the end of the program which was roughly 50 days. At first, I was a bit sceptical about living in a hotel for that long and in a small space; sharing a room. However, some of the elements that changed my mind was the atmosphere and I cannot stress enough how helpful and kind the staff were. They actually took the time to know you and actually knew my name, which I thought was incredible. I felt like I belonged and in the first 7 days, it already felt like home to me. Furthermore, its prime location was also one of the highlights for me, it was easy for me to get to anywhere from central of Tokyo. I strongly recommend this place, it might not be the fanciest place in Tokyo but certainly the friendliest. I miss this place and Tokyo!! xx

The hotel's location, staff, comfort and cleanliness are excellent, its really basic but cheap and cheerful. The hotel breakfast thats included in the price is totally horrid. Its white toast and coffee. As a vegan and a human that values basic nutrition, it was under nourishing, cheap and very uninspiring. Whats most disappointing is that it isn't reflective of the rest of the hotel or Japanese culture.

Excellent room for an excellent price. The staff were involved in guests' experiences, shared tips and recommendations and even took some volunteers on their sister locations Sumo experience trip because they had extra spots available. Highly recommend this accomodation.

This is the 3rd time I have stayed at the Sakura Hotel Jimbocho and I will most definitely come back. The staff is friendly, the prices are reasonable, and the comfort is relaxing. Thanks again guys, until next time.

Nippon Budokan is only a 10 minute walk from here. I had a private room it was quiet and I slept well. Akihabara is a short walk away. Harajuku is maybe half an hour away. The cost and location was perfect. I spoke essentially no Japanese and the staff was very understanding and helpful.

If you are looking hotel near to subway, clean, comfort and cheap stay at this hotel. My kids 8 years old also stay for free. The cafe downstairs is good, you can have your fast noodle and other instant food there.

We always come back here for the amazing, friendly, helpful staff. The central location with lots of diverse restaurants and convenience stores is perfect for us. The cafe on site is handy and generous free breakfast. In house cooked food and drinks available all day and inexpensive. This place has an army of cleaning ladies who swoop in around 10am and leave crisp fresh white linen and sparkling facilities in their wake. We love it here.

This hotel is the best you can get for the price. Since this is my 2nd visit I made the quick choice to book this place again. The rooms are nice, comes with a tv and an AC outlet. The staff go out of their way to help you and encourage you to go to their events they organize which are a great experience. Glad to say that the staff here are now my friends.A+

Not a single complaint with the hotel, it is a great place with great staff and you always make friends there! i stay here for a couple of nights every year every time i travel to japan and cannot recommend anywhere else. The price is really good but even if it were double i would still stay. THANK YOU SAKURA HOTEL!

We have stayed here 3 years before and came to here again. Every thing as good as before and we found several improvements. It is no doubt the place is perfect for anyone go to Budoukan, Shinjuku, Akihabara.

Excellent hotel with all basic facilities. Very friendly and helpful staff who can all speak English. Close to the Jimbocho station. Provides all necessary facilities and is very clean. Rooms come in different sizes and are very safe.

It was a very comfortable stay. I stayed in a private room with a comfortable bed and even if the shower and toilet were communal, they provide you with soap (you have to rent a towel for 100 yen but they do give you a complementary hand towel so...). The staff is friendly and helpful excited to have people from overseas and hear their stories. Did I mention it’s super close to the station and a 7-eleven?

the sakura hotel chain is excellent value for a stay in tokyo. i have been many times to their hotels, including jimbocho, and always find the hotel clean, safe, convenient and friendly. the staff is very helpful for any concerns or questions you may have.

Very close to many subway lines. clean showers and bathrooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped us with 24hr food. It had a great variety for breakfast! I will start traveling to more hostels if they are all like this!!

I've stayed at this hotel four times and highly recommend it. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is fantastic and speak many languages fluently. The hours of free breakfast (4:30-11 am) are the longest I've ever experienced and having the cafe available 24/7 is a great bonus. The hotel is located very stop to the metro station and the neighborhood itself is a great area, full of restaurants and bookstores.

Good hotel for everyone who takes a easy tripFriendly costumer serviceAffordable priceIt is very near Tokyo metro station Only one problem is that the ROOM IS NOT SOUND PROOFING Otherwise the hotel is approximately comfortable

was with my family for 1 week and it was a very good experience . friendly people and really clean facilities. Breakfast is included in the price, and the location in the city is perfect to visit Tokio really close to the subway and in the middle of a nice area with a lot of turistic places to see

excellent! I am very pleased with the hotel, environment and cleanliness of the hotel as well as the staff, they have free breakfast nothing fancy but enough to fill your hunger in the morning :) affordable.

Service is great and the rooms are a little small but clean. The hotel is located in the center of Tokyo, making it an easy access point to travel to other parts of Tokyo and other cities. The subway station is close to the hotel and easy to access. There's even bread, soup, and drinks for breakfast included with your stay. Overall great place for anyone planning to do a lot of exploring and travelling in Japan!

3 night stay in a dorm. Very clean and comfortable. 24 hr access and reception staff. Centrally located but on a quiet side street with good lighting. Very helpful and pleasent staff. Breakfast is basic but unlimited. Easy to get to from either Narita or Haneda airport with only 1 change on the subway from both airports. Really good base from which to explore Tokyo.

My partner and I had a ten-night stay in this hotel/hostel and loved it! We were able to get a room just one week in advance, and the prices were super reasonable. The place is kept very clean, with the rooms and shared amenities being cleaned every single day. Both private rooms and shared dormitories are available, with free wifi access to all. I enjoyed the included breakfast every morning in the cafe/lobby (basic toast and drinks). The staff were very warm and welcoming, and saw us off with a big smile when our stay ended. I know I'll be staying here next time I'm in Tokyo!

Stayed here to be close to Nippon Budokan event (walk 10-15min). Jimbocho station exit A1 is 5min walk. If you have a big/heavy luggage, note that exit A1 has 1 section without escalator. My single room was basic - bed, desk, chair, wall mirror, small TV, hooks on the wall and 2 hangers. Single room comes with a yukata and small face towel that is changed daily. I rented a bath towel from reception. 100yen is per rental. Furnishings are dated but clean. Aircon was good strength. Wifi dropped often. Toilets were alright. Showers are divided into wet and dry area (hooks and a railing). Basic quality of shower gel and rinse-shampoo (i.e. shampoo and conditioner in one). Didn't experience queuing for toilet, shower or wash basin. Building has only 1 elevator but I didn't experience long waits for it. Breakfast was bread, butter/jams, hot soup and choices of tea and coffee. Eggs cost extra. The breakfast time 4.30-11am was great as I had to leave before 6am once and I awoke late at 10+am another day. Reception staff spoke good English. Besides the convenience stores and drug stores that are a few minutes walk away, staff showed these were also within 5-10min walk : Daiso 100yen shop, Don Quijote, a 24hour supermarket, various eateries and good massage (at street junction of Jimbocho A1 exit)

Room was tiny but clean and cheap! Great stuff and hospitality. I met good travelers from all over the world!! The location is very convenient as well. I could easily go to any sightseeing places. I would recommend to travelers who are busy going a lot of places in Tokyo!!

review_body: I stayed 12/19 - 22 . The hotel was very close to Jimbocho station and also not far from Kudansita station! I came from Narita airport and took Keisei 1000yen bus to Tokyo station. Came to hotel from Nihonbasi station to Kudansita station. Booked 1bed in women dorm and very satisfied. Staffs were nice and facilities were good. On the first night, there were noisy ppl next room and kept talking till 4a.m. I had to knock on their door to say shut up. The wall is super thin. if you are a sensitive person when sleep, think again. Rest of nights were very fine except noise from outside using hair dryer but bearable.Never had to wait for shower or toilet or sink to wash. A bit surprised when a men was walking around the sink to his room only with a T shirt and a underwear (without pants)Since the metro runs till late, able to visit Roppongi and came back around 11:45 p.m. feeling safe around neighbors. Many convenient stores around the hotel. Easy access to Sibuya. Main event of my trip was attending GOT7 concert in Budokan near the hotel. It was really close that I can walk to the concert hall to buy merchandises and came back to rest before the concert. If you have plan to attend a concert at Budokan and have thin wallet, I recommend this hotel. If GOT7 performs again at Budokan, I am willing to stay again in this hotel. The breakfast was good. Toasts, coffee , butter and jam.호텔 이 가격에 진짜 괜찮았어요. 도미토리 이용이라서 2층침대였는데 저는 1층이라 바닥에 짐을 펼쳐놓고 쓰거나 콘센트도 사용하기 편리했는데 2층으로 배정받으면 약간 불편할수는 있을것 같아요. 1층에 자리 있으면 옮겨달라고 요구하면 옮겨주더라구요. 제 친구가 저보다 하루 늦게 체크인을 해서 제가 체크인할때 같은방으로 묶어달라고 했더니 그렇게 해주셨고 각 침대마다 커텐이 있어서 잠을 자거나 옷을 갈아입을때 사적 공간이 필요하면 커텐치면 되어서 좋았어요. 보조배터리, 휴대폰, 포켓 와이파이까지 충전하려니 콘센트 갯수가 모자랄뻔 했는데 다행히 2층 쓰시는 분들이 없거나 시간대가 달라서 이용에 불편은 없었습니다. 불안하시면 멀티탭을 가져가시는게 좋을수도!싼가격에 굉장히 만족스러운 이용이었습니다!

Staffs are hospitality and warming. Chinese, English, Japanese (even Spanish) are no problem. I have joined Sakura hotel jogging event where meet numbers of Japanese and overseas friends. After jogging, food serving is quit good! Thank you Sakura Hotel.

I had a great time at the Sakura Hotel Jimbocho. The rooms and washrooms are great and clean. You feel very well and safe. The location of the accommodation is very good and is centrally located. You can go everywhere from here by metro. The staff is great and is available for questions and makes the stay unforgettable. Thank you again!

My family and friends fell in love with this hotel. This hotel not just near to the subway and halal restaurant but also the room is really nice and warm. We loved the bunker bed so much. The staff are really nice and welcomed us. We will definitely stay at this hotel if we visit Tokyo again.

My family - 5 persons - was here two days and this hotel was very comfortable that I expected.Room charge was very very cheep.This hotel is very close to subway. Jimbocho station is so useful because this station meet 3 subway line.

Hello,I stayed at Sakura Hotel for the 3 weeks that I was in Tokyo. I found the room was adequate for my needs (I only need somewhere to rest for 8, so I can explore for the the other 16). The room was compact (typical in Tokyo) but had a comfy bed and a great A/C. The entire building is very secure, and clean. There was always a lovely cleaning lady around somewhere hard at work. The shower facilities were good as well, hot water was working and in ample supply. Food was tasty and cheap downstairs but most importantly the staff were always cheerful and willing to assist in anyway possible. Location wise it was also a big plus for me. Train station is close and so was an array of shops and restaurants to try. I'd be happy to stay here again!

This was arguably one of the most fantastic stays I have ever been to. The staff made me feel welcomed and was ALWAYS helpful, and vibrant with their genuine smiles. I HIGHLY recommend for others to come stay here if they ever have a chance to stay in Tokyo. YOU WONT REGRET IT!!!

Spending time here has become one of the most unforgettable memories, the friendly attitude of the staff and the other people staying there make you feel at home and never lonely.They also organize various events so that you can never get bored and get involved culturally with locals as well.The location is perfect and central.I very recommend this place to group of friends but most of all to solo travellers.

I loved my stay at the Sakura Hotel Jimbocho, the receptionists are smiling, pleasant and attentive, the decor with all these flags and all these photos illustrate a healthy, international and friendly, I met Lithuanians, passionate French by Japan like me, a Belgian and an Egyptian, these people have become my friends. The food offered is very good, diverse and reasonably priced. I particularly liked the hot chocolate, I have also taken several times. The rooms, although some are small, are comfortable, very well maintained and provide Yukatas allowing us a more immersive stay. Geographically, the hotel is located in a quiet little street that allows us to relax out of the noise of the city. At the entrance, we can see plenty of books and maps showing us activities and ideas of places to visit in Tokyo. This stay at Sakura Hotel Jimbocho has helped to strengthen my interest in Japan, which is my favorite country and if I have the opportunity, I will return.

I had a great time staying here. I was well rested, the staff were very helpful, the location was great for getting around tokyo, and it felt very cozy. It was also very conveniant that the cafe was part of the hotel so i didnt have to worry about meals.

super good and I want to live there and gust stay. staff is English, Japanese, Chinese speaker!! and near to the train station.如果想要旅遊非常建議可以來這邊 因為交通方便而且早餐也不錯 服務人員也熱情. 除此之外還有浴衣 價格便宜 該有的什麼都有 不要說住一晚 我想要把這邊當家了!!讚讚讚讚讚讚讚讚讚讚讚讚讚讚

I love the area and the hostel. Every time when I travel to Tokyo, my first choice is this hostel. Foods served in the first floor is good too. If you're too tired to go out for dinner, it could be a good choice.

review_body: I've stayed here more times than I count over the years and have felt great every single time. All off the staff speak great English and are very knowledgeable with regard to the surrounding areas. The hotels itself is located in central Tokyo which is just a few trains stops from most of the city sites. in the pst the staff have helped me plan out parts of my trips to other places in Japan. This is extremely helpful to fist time visitors. If you are lucky enough to come during the Oban or Golden week holidays you might be lucky to see the staff participate in some of the local celebrations too...

I have stayed at Sakura Hostels and one Sakura shared house before. The first hostel was in Asakasa and the shared house was in Sangenjaya. There are pros and cons to shared houses and hostels but I found Jimbocho was great for my trip in September. Location was a big thing for me, it was easy to take the metro from here even late at night coming from shibuya or roppongi. I stayed at a private for one night and one week in dorm room and both were great. The private room was a bit small compared to USA standards but this is japan. When in Rome. I never had an issue with noise although I always carry ear plugs when I travel just in case. The staff is very friendly and they all speak several languages. Peter and Naomi were very welcoming and took care of me when I was there. They host international events in the cafe that is integrated to the hotel. I really enjoyed them . I made a few friends with whom I ended up exploring Tokyo with and still keep in touch. If you are In Tokyo give it a try at least one night you will be hooked. I can't wait to go back for cherry blossom.

The room was great, private sheets with chargers and lights within the bedroom. The location was wonderful, with many great things to see in the area. The staff as well helped suggest different things to see and local events that I may have been interested. I would not have enjoyed my stay in Tokyo as much if not for the wonderful staff. A special thanks to H, N, and P for helping me enjoy the trip and showing me such great places to eat! I hope to be able to stop by my next visit to see the same staff members and have such a great experience again. Thank-you.

Had a wonderful experience with Sakura hotel considering the price point, and a very easy location to reach for tokyo based travel. There are ramps and elevators to and within the building so accesibility shouldn't be an issue, but each floor shares a set of showers and toilets, they were always clean so this never concerned me. The hotel also boasts a few handy facilities, an over night cafe where locals and travelers frequent, a great excuse to brush up on your linguistic skills, if you are so enclined. The main desk also sells handy items for tourists, such as toiletries, language handbooks and you can even purchase a rail card. Even if they lack something you need, there are convenience stores within a close radius (you will no doubt pass them if you make the trip to the electric city).The crown jewel of the hotel are no doubt the staff, always welcoming, and sharing a wide range of languages spoken between them. You will feel at home thanks to them, some of which I still speak to occasionally after my trip to japan.

This is good place to stay in Tokyo. Almost in the centre part of Tokyo. So you can can go to different area easily. The staffs are very nice, they can provide enough information for my travelling. We recommend this hotel for other people.

The entire place was immaculately clean. Location is convenient - merely 2 stops away from Tokyo station. The cafe serves excellent food. The staff are gracious, welcoming and friendly - they offer you many tips about Tokyo and Japan. They also often have activities that you can partake in. Overall very comfortable and enjoyable experience.

I always travel every year to Japan with a group of tourist and I need a place to stay close to the central train station but also, near to nice places in Tokyo, so Sakura Hotel Jimbocho is the best option. I can get to the subway in a couple of minutes. Since there are two lines (and also a 3rd a block away): Hanzomon-line and Shinjuku-line, Akihabara is like 5 min. away, Shibuya at the end of the Hanzomon line and you can go to the area of Shinjuku on the line of its name. The rooms are clean, perfect, and you receive everyday a clean towel and slippers. Also, one of the best things is to wear a yukata theY give you every day and the best of all is the staff. Always with a smile. Since I travel from South-America it was a surprise to be welcomed by Peter, IN SPANISH!! This is my 6th time I stay there and I have no regrets.

The hotel was fine, for the prices, but the food is not too good and the staff is friendly but they don't know how to guide the guests if they have an emergency,( they just know about metro station, but google maps too, so it's the same to ask them or google it). One day I had to go to a clinic and they only told me to communicate through a green coin phone, which does not work as it is only for national calls (and they didn't tell me) and only They did me spend 1000 yen on unanswered calls (I found out later that the phone for international calls is a gray one, not the green that they have and say "international calls") . They should be more able to provide help, (for example: medical emergency or calls)because being nice and friendly anyone can, but when you have a problem, they just stand aside and one as a guest has to manage by self.

The hotel itself is great. The Sakura hotel has a 24 cafe and terrace, however a member of staff (Kaz) has been rude to our party and very disrespectful, he claims to have complaints yet all of the other other staff have been great. Peter is amazing and is a great manager and friend Niaomi is also a great member of staff. Kaz however has been very rude towards our party. He seems to have a disliking to British and Americans. He has kicked us out of the terrace which not even Peter (the manager) has not and has overall affected the view over the hotel and cafe as he has threatened to close the 24 hour cafe which he can't and has over all treated us poorly. We have no other problem with the staff and it was a good stay, just avoid contact with Kaz

the room is clean,i booked a room for 5 people,we all slept very well.this hotel also provide an easy breakfast like a toast with soup,it's great. i slept here for 2 nights,it's easy to go anywhere and all staff very helpful,they told me where should i go for shopping and how to take a transportation.

It's more of a hostel than a hotel as there are no private bathrooms and many shared dorm style rooms.The staff are professional and very helpful. Clean and tidy. Rooms are incredibly tiny.BUT...the noise factor is unbearable. The walls in the rooms are super thin. There are these really loud communal hairdryers on every level directly outside the bedrooms (Not inside a bathroom but directly outsdie your bedroom door). People use them at all hours of the night with no respect for others trying to sleep. The noise is non-stop. I was repeatedly woken up every night several times at 2am, 3am, 4am, 5am by people using the hairdryers outside my room. The 2 weeks I stayed at the Sakura hotel, I never got more than 2 hours sleep without being woken up by the damn things.People in the rooms next door can be heard having parties. The walls are so thin you can actually follow the convesations. The hostel has a wonderful communal area on the ground floor where people can hang out 24/7 but despite this, people prefer to party in the rooms. So if you're in Japan for work or study and need some sleep or quite, this is not the place to stay.One night my lovely neighbour started playing his guitar in his room at 2am on a weekday. Great player but c'mon man, people need to sleep. For the entire 2 weeks at my stay at the Sakura I was sleep deprived. My only regret was not moving to another hotel sooner. The staff here are fantastic, I can't fault them as they were very accomodating and friendly. The location is handy too. Sadly, because of loud noise at all hours of the night, I would not recommend this place to people seeking a peaceful night's rest.

Good points: very easy to get to on the Metro from the airport on the Z line (changing at Oshiage from the KS from Narita). A simple beakfast was included...toast, drinks and a clear soup that was really nice to get the day started. Location is also good for Shibuya and Shinjiku - both must see places. Friendly and clean. Nice kimonos to wear in the evening. Not so good... Room was tiny. 2 bunks with very little floor space. If you are familiar with backpackers hostels, you feel at home here. Relatively cheap for Tokyo and was a last minute booking so cannot complain too much. I would certainly recommend it if you don't mind shared facilities - which were spotless by the way.

Location;3 minutes walk from Jimbocho metro station or 15 min walk from Kanda station (JR).Wifi; working goodStaff; really friend and helpful.Room; small room for 2 person. no much space to but our luggage.Breakfast; it is simple. Coffee, tea, bread, butter, jam.

Location is near Jimbocho station, less than 5 mins walking distance. Decent size room for budget hotel standard with clean bathroom. The only problem is the room can be very cold at night especially during rainy days as the heater system does not really works very well.

We were traveling in a group of 3. The 3 person room was of decent size, well lit, came with a TV, and was comfortable. It seems like most of the staff if not all are multilingual, so it was very easy to communicate with them. They were all helpful and respectful.There are stairs and elevators to go to each floor. As for the rooms, there are no toilets, showers, or sinks. Instead, they are located in the center of the floor (2 female toilets, 2 male toilets, 2+2 sinks, 2 showers). I believe every floor has their own set. Although they are shared facilities, they are all clean and actually very pleasant to use. I never felt like it was uncomfortable or there was a lack of privacy. The shower is even behind two sets of doors. You may need to bring your own equipment for daily needs (ex. tooth brush, tooth paste, towels), but if you happen to forget anything, they either have it for sale or for rent. My favorite point would be the location. It's nice and quiet, the building was easy to find, and was very close to the train stations (Jimbocho station: Shinjuku, mita, hanzomon line). places like Shibuya, Shinjuku, and Akihabara are just 15 minutes away. Getting to farther away places like tsukiji fish market, Yokohama, Diver city, etc. was easy as well since the train station is in short walking distance.

This is the second time I have stayed with a Sakura hotel. This time I came with two friends at the start of December for 4 nights. It was conveniently located a 2 min walk from Jimbocho Station and a convenience store was just up the road. Jimbocho is known as the used book district so it is makes an interesting area to take a walk around and peek in unique stores. All the staff were really friendly and helpful directing us to some Lonely Planet guides that were available for guests on loan and all spoke English really well. My friends and I had a triple single room which had bunk beds and a fold out with a futon on it. The fold out wasn't the most comfortable of things but the bunk beds were decent. Each came with a nice fluffy doona plus extra blankets and heating was also available which helped combat the winter chill. Yukatas were also provided and the rooms were turned down daily which surprised me but it was nice. There was even a small desk and tv in the room. We didn't use the TV but the desk was handy! On our floor there were 2 female toilets and 2 female showers and vice versa. We never had to wait to use them so it worked out well. Sinks were communal. Sound proofing was good but then we had a pretty quiet floor. Wifi was free and service was good. Breakfast was included, it mainly consisted of toast with butter and jam and soup plus tea and coffee. There were more options like eggs that one could pay for. We were a bit disappointed to find out that tea and coffee was only available during breakfast unless you wanted to pay for it. The downstairs sitting area is nice and open most of the time with a sheltered outdoor patio that I gathered was for smoking. Overall I was pleased with Sakura and I would certainly return a third time for it was cheap, clean, & well-located.

The end of year and early new year had few hotel to stay for reasonable price in Tokyo.I was a little bit late to find a hotel room but fortunately i found this hotel.i recommend this hotel to foreigners because it is cheeper,5 minutes walk from subway station,breakfast is free.The hotel staffs all speak perfect english and helpful and friendly .There is pc for free and Wi-Fi freehelpful and room was really quiet.

I went for a week by the end of april, the staff is really welcoming and there are some who speak differente langagues (which is awesome as my native language is spanish). The place is clean as everyday at morning I saw staff doing a general cleaning. The beds... well...they could be a bit more comfortable (at least for my taste) but you get a big cozy futon-like blanket. The location is awesome, it has walking distance train stations, besides Jimbocho is known as the center used-book stores, so by walking around you'll find many interesting stores!! they also plan many activities in which residents can get involve.Overall I would go back, as it´s quite cheap compared to other places and you get a nice, clean, well located hostel.

Convinient location. Very near to subway station. Best to take a cab from Tokyo station if you have a lot of luggage  The staff were friendly, the bathrooms and the room were all very clean, and the ammenities (robe, bath towel, and free shampoo/body wash) were nice. The internet service is fast and good, and myself and my fellow vegan traveller loved that the 24 hour cafe had a soy latte on the menu!We truly loved this hotel, as we met quite a few travellers from all over. I would highly recommend this hotel for younger travellers.

Stayed in the hostel for four nights in a dorm room and one night in a private room. I had to move to a private room for one night as I booked rather late (three weeks before my trip) and there were no dorms available that night. The staff were very helpful though and kept in touch via email, updating me on the availability of their rooms. Even during my stay, the staff were all too willing to help with my planning and gave some useful tips for getting around. They were also kind enough to store my baggage for me during the days I had to switch rooms.The hotel itself is close to the train station which made it very convenient. Upon first arrival though, if you have large/heavy bags, you may have some trouble finding the station exit with an elevator (there's only one exit with an elevator -- others have escalators, some have only stairs). Jimbocho is also a nice, quiet town with some interesting shops and quite a lot of small restaurants and izakayas. For those who don't want breakfast at the hostel (which really is just coffee, tea, and bread), there are convenience stores and cafes in the area as well.

Small private room, shared bath in friendly,basic hostel located in nice area. Staff friendly, knowledgeable and courteous. Simple breakfast in cool, comfy lounge area. Good price for Tokyo accommodation.
